item.title: Perspectives on Catastrophes in the London Review of Books
item.description: What follows is a summary of 13 articles published in print or online by the LRB. It covers fat-tailed distributions, the traditional natural catastrophe perils, climate change and man-made, ecological collapse. I pick out a few common themes and summarise these at the end.

item.title: Insurance Industry Needs to Change to Avoid Profiteering from Climate Change
item.description: Climate risk is different to other catastrophe risk because the insurance industry is directly responsible for causing it. If companies do not change their habits to reduce their GHG emissions, they could be guilty of profiteering.
